page.title: 14Recreation in Nailsea
page.content: There are two small sports centres in Nailsea;-{Grove Sports Centre}and {Mizzymead Sports Centre.}They are both run by committees of local people. The Grove centre has facilities for badminton and table-tennis indoors and cricket outdoors. Mizzymead has a bowling green and tennis courts. There are public playing fields at the Scotch Horn Centre, a hall suitable for dramatic productions, weddings, public meetings etc., which has been built recently near the old glassworks site south of the High Street. A small play area with swings, climbing frame and slide provides some recreation for young children off Hannah More Road. The nearest swimming pool is in Backwell. There are football, hockey, cricket, chess, skittles, cycling, walking, croquet, orienteering clubs-- but no rugby club; a sad omission!
